title: Universal Plant Edibility Test
brief: Systematic 24+ hour process to test unknown plants for safe consumption when you can't identify them.
steps: Step 1: Test only abundant plants - ensure enough to make testing worthwhile.
Step 2: Separate plant into parts (roots, leaves, flowers, etc.) - each part requires separate 24+ hour testing.
Step 3: Smell the plant part - avoid if it has strong or acid odors.
Step 4: Place small amount on inside of wrist for 15 minutes - test for irritation.
Step 5: If no irritation, place on corner of mouth for 15 minutes.
Step 6: If no irritation, place on tip of tongue for 15 minutes - don't swallow.
Step 7: If no irritation, chew and hold in mouth for 15 minutes - don't swallow.
Step 8: If no ill effects, swallow small amount and wait 8 hours.
Step 9: If no ill effects after 8 hours, eat 1/4 cup and wait another 8 hours.
Step 10: If no ill effects, plant part is safe to eat in normal quantities.
warnings: Each plant PART requires the full 24+ hour test - roots, leaves, berries are all separate.
Don't eat any other food during the 8-hour waiting periods.
Stop immediately and induce vomiting if any ill effects occur.
Even after testing, eat new plant foods in moderation at first.
